questions.question: How can you increase gravity between two objects?

choices.answer: reduce the distance between the masses by half
reduce the small mass by half

questions.question: A  satellite is orbiting the earth at a constant speed,how is gravity acting on  it?

choices.answer: it is pointing toward the center of the earth
points in the direction it is moving

questions.question: A satellite moves in  orbit around earth & maintains a constant speed. What will it experience?

choices.answer: changing gravitational force toward the earth
net gravitational force toward the earth

questions.question: If you were able to travel to the moon, your weight would
If you drop an apple an a basketball from a building at the same time, what would happen?

choices.answer: the apple would hit first because it has less gravity
both hit the ground at the same time

questions.question: Which objects have the greater gravitational attraction?
Which is true of mass and weight?

choices.answer: Mass stays the same and weight is less on the moon
both mass and weight are greater on the moon
weight is the same but mass is less on the moon

questions.question: Why can people jump on the moon?

choices.answer: there is no atmosphere on the moon
the moon has less gravitational force
space suits helped them jump higher

questions.question: What keeps the Moon in orbit?
What keeps planets in orbit?
The force of gravity on an object depends on the object's ___________.
Why would a comet travel more quickly as it got closer to the sun?

choices.answer: the mass of the comet increases
the temperature of the comet increases
the frictional force on the comet increases
the gravitational pull on the comet increases

questions.question: Which describes why a satellite's velocity is not constant?

choices.answer: the force of the satellite's mass is constantly decreasing

questions.question: What effect does gravity have on a person living on earth?

choices.answer: it causes us to have weight
it causes us to have mass
causes a heavy person to fall faster

questions.question: What determines the gravitational pull on an object on the moon?

choices.answer: the surface features of the moon
the rotational speed of the moon

questions.question: If you were to travel to the moon how would your weight and mass change?

choices.answer: mass would be the same, weight would decrease

questions.question: Why do satellites need to reach a specific speed to escape from Earth's surface?

choices.answer: to break through the sound barrier

questions.question: 3 cans-1 empty-1 full-1 half full. You drop them at  the same time, which one hits first?

choices.answer: all hit at the same time

questions.question: Why do positions of stars change?

choices.answer: stars get smaller as they age
stars get bigger as they age

choices.answer: Saturn is much farther away from the sun
